The differences in the 47 transmissibility, pathogenicity and clinical manifestations of different types of strains 48 require further investigations. 49 50

body_text.text: In the epidemic evolution of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 26 (SARS-CoV-2), the issues of mutation, origin, typing and the effect of mutation on 27 molecular detection remain to be unrevealed. In order to identify the evolutionary 28 relationship of SARS-CoV-2 and evaluate the detection efficiency of primers that are 29 currently used in different countries, we retrieved genomic sequences of 373 30 SARS-CoV-2 strains from multiple databases and performed genome-wide variation 31 analysis. According to the nucleotide C28144T variation, the SARS-CoV-2 can be 32 divided into group A (117 strains) and group B (256 strains). The spike protein gene is speculated that the Washington strain is more like an ancestor type, and the Wuhan 44 strain is the offspring of the group A virus strain. By comparing the detection Introduction: 55 The severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) started to 56 emerge in Wuhan in December 2019. As of April 20, 2020, more than 2.4 57 million cases have been reported in more than 211 countries and regions. 58 While the outbreak and pandemic of SARS-CoV-2 poses a great threat to public 59 health, in-depth studies have been conducted on key issues such as 60 transmission ability, epidemiology, clinical characteristics, pathogenic 61 mechanism, clinical treatment, and laboratory testing. Regarding the origin of 62 SARS-CoV-2, bat coronavirus RaTG13 was found to be highly similar to 63 SARS-CoV-2, so it was speculated that bats might be the original host of the 64 virus [1] . It was further found that the virus isolated from pangolin was similar 65 to SARS-CoV-2, suggesting that pangolin might be an intermediate host [2, 3] . 66 By comparing the genomes of existing coronavirus such as SARS-CoV-2, 67 MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, it was found that RNA editing in the human body 68 is related to certain mutations obtained by virus evolution [4] . In order to 69 reveal more clues of the origin of SARS-CoV-2, which is still an urgent problem to 70 be solved, we retrieved the publicly available virus sequences from global 71 database sources such as GISAID and NCBI to analyze the emerged mutation, 72 evolution and typing of SARS-CoV-2, and to evaluate the influence of its 73 mutations on molecular detection in current clinical settings. and used to construct the phylogenetic tree by The variation percentage and pairwise distance were calculated using 87 MEGA-X32. BioEdit was used to calculate the number of mutation sites, and 88 . The copyright holder for this preprint this version posted May 3, 2020 . . https://doi.org/10.1101 /2020 Based on the position and nucleotide variation of the phylogenetic tree, 104 we compared the evolutionary variation between SARS-CoV-2 representative 105 strains. WA1-F6 (sample collected on January 25, 2020) strain has one 106 nucleotide variation compared with the closed bat strain (bat/Yunnan/RaTG13). 107 Compared with WA1-F6 strain, we find that Chongqing/YC01, Fujian/8 and 108 HKU-SZ-002a strain (in the same evolutionary branch with WA1-F6 strain) 109 showed 2, 1 and 2 nucleotide variation respectively; While Wuhan epidemic 110 strain Wuhan-Hu-1 (sample collected in November 2019), which is far from 111 the outer group, has 3 nucleotide variation; and WA-UW82, which is far from 112 the outer group, has 8 nucleotide variation (sample collected in March 2020). 113 Interestingly, the WA-UW82 strain appeared one-and-a-half month after the 114 WA1-F6 strain became popular in the Washington area of the United States. 115 The WA-UW82 strain mutated and evolved from WA1-F6 in the 5 'UTR, 116 ORF1ab, S, ORF3a and ORF8 coding regions, whereas no positive selection 117 was found (Table 3) . FIGREF0.text: B, of which 30 strains were from European and American countries in March 35 (especially Washington, USA). These mutations are likely to be influenced by the 36 environment or the immunization selection pressure of different populations. 37 Although the mutation is not in the receptor binding region (RBD) and alkaline 38 cleavage region, it may also affect the ability of transmission and pathogenicity; 39 however, the significance is not yet clear. As the ratio of A / B strains in the epidemic 40 months showed an increasing trend (0.35: 1 in January, 0.62: 1 in February and 0.76: 41 1 in March), it seems that the transmissibility of group A strains becomes stronger 42 with time. Based on the variation of 11 nucleotide sites during the epidemic process, it 43

FIGREF2.text: . The nucleotides and amino acids in the ORF8 region of 124 the sequence were analyzed, and the positions of different mutated strains in 125 the evolutionary tree were compared in Figure 1. It was found that nucleotides 126 T251C (28144 in total) or 197 strains of amino acid L84S formed two clusters 127 in the phylogenetic tree. To test this assumption, all 373 SARS-CoV-2 genome 128 sequences were integrated into the phylogenetic tree in batches, and the results 129 remained consistent. According to the nucleotide C28144T variation, 130 SARS-CoV-2 can be clustered into two large groups. The group A virus has a C 131 at position 28,144, whereas group B virus has a T. Among the 39 strains of the 132 group B virus, the A1841G non-synonymous mutation (D614G) occurred in 133 the 1841 position (23403 positions) of the S gene coding region during the 134 SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, forming a B1 subgroup (Supplementary Figure synonymous mutation of A1841G (D614G) occurred in the S gene coding 138 region 1841 (total 23403), but no mutation occurred in the receptor binding 139 region (RBD, S protein amino acid 451-509) and alkaline cleavage region 140 (667-694) in WA-UW82. Further analysis of the S-coding regions of 373 141 strains of SARS-CoV-2 genome collected from December 2019 to March 31, 142 2020 revealed that 39 strains had mutations of D614G, and 334 strains had no 143 mutations. Of the 39 strains, only BetaCoV/Germany/BavPat1/2020 was 144 mutated at the end of January, 10 strains were mutated in February, and the 145 remaining 28 strains were mutated in March. Except for the 146 Wuhan/HBCDC-HB-06/2020 strain from Asia, the vast majority of The influence of the variation to the nucleic acid detection 150 In order to evaluate the impact of nucleotide variation on clinical test, we 151 compared the 373 SARS-CoV-2 genome sequences with currently used 152 primers that were reported by the Chinese Center for Disease Control and 153

FIGREF3.text: may not lead to false-negative results in PCR detection. Whereas 161 the nucleotide mutations have occurred in the N or E amplification region near 162 the 3 'end of the European primers, that may affect the amplification results. 163 Although European primers use degenerate primers at the RdRp amplification 164 region, fortunately there is no mutation observed yet. The difference between 165 German and European primers is that the former amplifies RdRP, E, and N 166 region, and the latter amplifies only RdRP and E region. The RdRP reverse 167 primer "S" is designed according to the base C of SARS-CoV-2 and the base G 168 of the bat SARS-related coronavirus, while no mutation of base T has been 169 found at this location in SARS-CoV-2. Therefore, the use of Chinese CDC and 170 European primer sequence in PCR detection will not be affected by this 171 mutation, which can ensure the accuracy and quality of clinical PCR of the virus have been found. There have also been 180 in-depth studies on the evolution of variation [9, 10] , which however only 181 studied the variation and evolution of SARS-CoV-2 strain in the early stage NCBI and the Global Coronavirus Data Sharing and Analysis System 185 of the National Microbiology Data Center of China from the end of 2019 to 186 March 31, 2020. FIGREF4.text: class A strain got stronger over time. However, the 198 differences in the transmission ability, pathogenic ability and clinical 199 performance of the two types of strains have not been reported, and it is 200 unknown whether there is a difference in the mortality caused by them. It is 201 worthy of further follow-up studies by molecular epidemiology experts TRS), which eliminated ORF8 transcription, thereby enhancing the 206 transcription efficiency of downstream N-terminal genes. The ORF8 region is 207 considered to be an evolutionary hotspot of SARS related coronaviruses 208 (SARSr-CoVs) and an important region for the evolution of SARSr-CoVs. The 209 ORF8 region has been shown to play an important role in the virus replication 210 efficiency of SARS-CoV, interspecies transmission, and adaptation to human 211 hosts. It is speculated that it may be the result of the adaptation of 212 SARS-CoV-2 to the human host, and it has undergone reorganization selection 213 during the transmission from animal to human [12] . In the SARS-CoV-2 214 pandemic, 39 strains of the same group B (group B1) had A1841G 215 non-synonymous mutation (D614G) in the 1,841 position (23,403 positions in 216 total) in the S gene coding region. Of these, 30 strains were isolated from 217 European and American countries in March (especially Washington, USA), 218 whereas in comparison, only 1 strain was isolated in January and 10 strains 219 were isolated in February. 220 At the end of the writing this article, we downloaded 62 new sequences 221 .

FIGREF5.text: all from Europe and the United States. This may be mutated by 228 the selection pressure of the environment or the immunity of different 229 population. Although the mutation is not in the RBD and alkaline lysis zone, it 230 may also affect the transmission and pathogenic ability, but its significance is 231 not yet clear. These results suggest that the virus may have undergone new 232 mutations under the pressure of environmental selection, forming a new 233 epidemic strain. The difference in the ability of the mutation to spread, 234 pathogenicity, clinical manifestations and outcome of the strain needs to be 235 determined by molecular epidemiologists and clinicians in further followfirst set of 41 infected patients in Wuhan, 27 were associated with 238 the South China Seafood Market of Wuhan city, and the infected subjects 239 spread them to others outside the market, however, this conclusion has been 240 controversial [13] . In this study, the strains that have a close phylogenetic 241 relationship with the outer group bat/Yunnan/RaTG13 are all group A strains. 242 There is no obvious difference in the time of initial epidemic between group A 243 and B strains. The original virus strains belonging to group A, such as 244 Chongqing (Chongqing/YC01), Fujian (Fujian/8), Shenzhen (HKU-SZ-002a), 245 and Washington (USA/WA1-F6), etc., are all phylogenetically far away from 246 the group B strain that were popular in Wuhan. Four family members Wuhan. Thus, it is speculated that there are at least two or more 252 original infection sources, or that two types of strains are spreading 253 simultaneously in a certain infection source. 254 By analyzing the 11 nucleotide sites that can be mutated in the epidemic 255 .

FIGREF6.text: the United States is more like an ancestor type, although its onset 261 time is later than Wuhan patients. The epidemic strain in Wuhan should be a 262 variant of group A strains. We thus speculated that the group A strains were 263 already prevalent before the outbreak in Wuhan at the end of December 2019. 264 Through analysis of 10 strains from Mexico, the Netherlands, Sweden, 265 Finland, Portugal, and Peru, it was found that the nucleotides corresponding to 266 the 5 'initiation segment of the N region forward primer were all mutated from 267 GGG to AAC. This mutation may cause false negative results in PCR 268 amplification detection, leading to the missed diagnosis and the spread of the 269 virus. However, the primer sequences provided by the Chinese CDC and 270 Europe did not find nucleotide variations in the amplified regions of ORF1ab 271 and RdRp. Therefore, the quality of screening COVID -19 by clinical PCR 272 could be guaranteed by using the detection kits that include Chinese CDC , the global spread of SARS-CoV-2 has not been effectively 275 controlled at present, . Group B should be the mutated strain of group A, and 276 the group A strain is easier to spread. We should pay close attention to the 277 variation and significance in the epidemic process, especially the 278 pathogenicity, transmissibility, clinical process and prognosis of different 279 groups of strains are not clear. BioEdit was used to 83 compare the genome sequence and remove those with ambiguous loci. After 84 continued retrieval, 373 full genomes were finally obtained by March 31, 2020,
